item.title: Auto-blur background script with hsetroot and xdotool
item.description: so yesterday when i was trying out this rather interesting wm (it has a flipping rainbow!!!!), i found this simple auto blur script that’s also caught my interest (directly copied) : #!/bin/bash win="$(lsw)" if [[ $win ]]; then hsetroot -fill $HOME/wall.jpg -blur 15 else hsetroot -fill $HOME/wall.jpg -blur 15 fi it’s simply uses lsw command that according to the wmutils readme is a utility to list window and then run hsetroot command to blur the image and set the output as background.

item.title: Clipboard's copy-paste in Vim
item.description: Simple “copy-paste” method from clipboard using xsel Install xsel example using arch : sudo pacman -S xsel Create some keymap on your ~/.vimrc " Copy to X CLIPBOARD map <leader>cc :w !xsel -i -b<CR> map <leader>cp :w !xsel -i -p<CR> map <leader>cs :w !xsel -i -s<CR> " Paste from X CLIPBOARD map <leader>pp :r!xsel -p<CR> map <leader>ps :r!xsel -s<CR> map <leader>pb :r!xsel -b<CR> note that <leader> here is mapped to backslash key \ by default
